title: Urban E-commerce Reverse Logistics Optimization
desc_split: An online retailer must efficiently manage same-day delivery of packages to customers and collect returned items using a fleet of trucks. Each truck has a maximum capacity of <capacity> kg and must deliver items to customers (linehaul) before picking up returned goods (backhaul). Routes must stay within a maximum distance of <distance_limit> km to ensure drivers return to the warehouse before the end of their shift. The goal is to minimize total travel distance while adhering to capacity limits and the delivery-first sequence, ensuring all customer orders and returns are handled without overloading vehicles.
label: vrpbl

title: Agricultural Supply and Harvest Logistics
desc_split: A farming cooperative delivers agricultural inputs like seeds and fertilizers to scattered farms (linehaul) and collects harvested produce (backhaul) from the same locations. Each truck can carry up to <capacity> kg, and deliveries must precede pickups to prevent cross-contamination. Routes must not exceed <distance_limit> km to avoid produce spoilage during transport and ensure trucks return before dusk for overnight storage. The cooperative seeks optimized routes to reduce fuel costs while meeting all farms’ demands and collection requirements.
label: vrpbl

title: Construction Material and Equipment Routing
desc_split: A construction company sends trucks to deliver building materials (e.g., cement, lumber) to job sites (linehaul) and retrieve unused or rented equipment (backhaul) afterward. The trucks (<capacity> cubic meters) must first deliver new gear to park kiosks (linehaul) and then collect used gear (backhaul) for cleaning and redistribution. All routes must be within a <distance_limit> km radius of the central depot to ensure same-day service and prevent gear from being stranded overnight.
label: vrpbl

title: Offshore Wind Farm Maintenance and Waste Retrieval
desc_split: A renewable energy company sends service vessels to offshore wind turbines to deliver repair parts and tools while collecting废旧 mechanical components and waste materials for recycling. Each vessel has a <capacity> ton limit and must return to the coastal depot within a <distance_limit> km radius to avoid exceeding fuel reserves. The route planning must prioritize delivering supplies first, then retrieving waste, while accounting for ocean currents and equipment storage constraints.
label: vrpbl

title: Satellite Component Delivery and Rocket Fuel Canister Retrieval
desc_split: A space logistics company must deliver precision satellite components to launch sites (linehaul) and retrieve used rocket fuel canisters from remote desert launch pads (backhaul). Each vehicle has a strict weight capacity to handle fragile equipment without overloading. Deliveries must precede pickups to ensure fuel canisters are only collected after components are safely delivered. Routes are constrained by maximum distance limits to ensure vehicles can return to the depot before their fuel reserves are depleted, avoiding risky detours in uninhabited terrain. The goal is to minimize total travel distance while adhering to safety and operational requirements.
label: vrpbl

title: Vintage Car Rental and Tire Recycling Logistics
desc_split: A luxury car rental service delivers classic automobiles to clients’ locations (linehaul) and later collects used tires from rental sites for recycling (backhaul). Each truck must carry a limited number of cars due to space constraints, and pickups can only occur after all deliveries are completed to prevent mixing vehicles with waste. Routes are restricted to a maximum distance to ensure drivers can return within a single shift, avoiding overnight stays in remote areas. The challenge is optimizing routes to balance fuel efficiency and vehicle capacity while serving high-value clients efficiently.
label: vrpbl

title: Offshore Research Vessel Supply and Sample Retrieval
desc_split: A marine research organization supplies scientific equipment and provisions to offshore research vessels (linehaul) and retrieves collected biological samples for analysis (backhaul). Each boat has limited cargo space, requiring precise load planning. Samples must be picked up after supplies are delivered to ensure temperature-sensitive items are prioritized. Routes must stay within a maximum distance to comply with fuel and safety regulations, as vessels cannot refuel far from shore. The goal is to minimize total travel while safeguarding both equipment and perishable samples.
label: vrpbl

title: High-End Art Transport and Secure Retrieval for Exhibitions
desc_split: A fine art logistics firm transports valuable sculptures and paintings to museums (linehaul) and later retrieves them for return to private collectors (backhaul). Vehicles have strict weight and space limits to protect fragile items. Pickups can only occur after deliveries to prevent mixing outgoing and incoming shipments. Routes are constrained by distance limits to ensure artworks are returned within a single day, avoiding storage risks. The challenge is minimizing travel costs while adhering to tight security and operational protocols.
label: vrpbl

title: Automotive Rental Company’s Electric Vehicle Delivery and Battery Swap
desc_split: An electric vehicle rental service delivers charged EVs to customer locations (linehaul) and collects depleted batteries for rapid recharging (backhaul). Each truck carries a limited number of vehicles and must deliver all EVs before retrieving batteries to maintain inventory balance. Routes are restricted by maximum distance to ensure drivers can return to depots for battery swaps without exceeding shift limits. The goal is to optimize routes for fuel efficiency while meeting demand and maintaining battery availability for future rentals.
label: vrpbl

title: Offshore Oil Rig Supply and Used Equipment Retrieval
desc_split: An oil company must supply critical equipment and consumables to offshore drilling rigs while retrieving used containers and obsolete machinery. Vessels depart from a coastal depot, first delivering linehaul items like drilling parts and safety gear to rigs, then collecting backhaul loads of empty containers and worn tools. Each vessel has a strict capacity limit, must adhere to a maximum travel distance to ensure safe round-trip fuel reserves, and enforce delivery-first protocols to avoid operational bottlenecks. The goal is to optimize routes for all rigs while preventing overloads and maintaining strict distance compliance.
label: vrpbl

title: Mobile Medical Clinic Equipment Redistribution
desc_split: A healthcare nonprofit operates mobile clinics visiting remote villages, delivering medical supplies and collecting used equipment for sterilization. Each vehicle first distributes linehaul items like vaccines and diagnostic kits, then retrieves expired medications and contaminated materials (backhaul). Routes must stay within a distance limit to return to the central hub before sunset, and vehicle capacities must balance outgoing and incoming loads. The challenge is minimizing travel while ensuring all villages receive supplies and hazardous materials are securely returned for disposal.
label: vrpbl
